Fact Finding Phase
• A judge decides the truth value of facts in the considered case.
Facts should contribute to judgement using evidence.
• Evidence itself is also a fact so we need to decide the truth value
of evidence.
• We need evidential reasoning as well as reasoning from basic facts.
• Note that the truth value might be undeﬁned (non-liquet).
For example, suppose a judge would like to decide whether there was
an agreement about purchase of goods or not.
If a plaintiﬀgave
some basic facts such as email exchanges which can derive the fact of
agreement, a judge will take into account of this base fact to decide
whether there was an agreement.
